kihkcjs5Text:
Patients frequently discontinue treatment due to
common side effects
kihkcjs6Text:
The majority of patients treated
with antidepressants experience
one or more bothersome side
effect1
kihkcjs7Text:
As many as one quarter of
patients discontinue their
antidepressants due to difficult-
to-tolerate side effects1
kihkcjs8Text:
Side effects often create
barriers to achieving
remission, as well as preventing
relapse and recurrence1
kihkcjs9Text:
Others may continue on
antidepressant therapy but
experience diminished quality
of life related to troublesome
side effects1
kihkcjsbText:
Most common reason cited
for SSRI discontinuation

falls, weight gain, potential for serotonin syndrome, 
discontinuation syndrome<sup><small>2,3</small></sup>
</font>
Brintellix_777136da3:
GI, activation, sexual dysfunction, increased pulse
rate, dry mouth, excessive sweating, increased
blood pressure, potential for serotonin syndrome, discontinuation symptoms2,3
Brintellix_742bc970f:
Cardiovascular effects, arrhythmias, orthostatic
hypotension, dry mouth, sexual dysfunction, tachycardia,
impaired vision, memory and concentration impairments,
sedation, weight gain, myoclonus2,3
Brintellix_70b83c51d:
Hypertensive crisis, potential for serotonin syndrome,
orthostatic hypotension, weight gain, sexual dysfunction,
headaches, insomnia2,3
Brintellix_789beb734:
<font style="font-size: 14px; font-family: '3_BNJCUB+AvenirNextLTPro-Regular';color: rgb(100, 94, 94);line-height: 1;display:inline-block;">
Nausea, headaches, dizziness, insomnia, somnolence,
tremors, seizures, dry mouth, sedation, weight gain<sup><small>2-4</small></sup>
</font>

reuptake inhibitor; TCA, tricyclic antidepressant.
</font>

Brintellix_779a2d111:
Decreased sexuality is considered to be a bothersome adverse
effect related to SSRI treatment
Brintellix_7144c1ed2:
In an observational study, adverse events were the most common reason
cited for SSRI discontinuation after 3 months
